headline: American Water and City of Camden Pay Tribute to 9/11 Victims and First Responders on 24th Anniversary
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., September 11, 2025--American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., and the City of Camden pay tribute to the victims and first responders of the attacks on September 11, 2001.

headline: American Water Works' Arm Installs New Battery Energy Storage System
summary: AWK is boosting resilience with new battery storage in California, replacing diesel generators and improving reliability.

raw.headline: American Water Works' Arm Installs New Battery Energy Storage System
raw.summary: AWK is boosting resilience with new battery storage in California, replacing diesel generators and improving reliability.

headline: American Water Works (AWK): A Fresh Look at Valuation After Recent Share Price Fluctuations
summary: American Water Works Company (AWK) has caught some investor attention lately. While there has not been a headline-grabbing event that triggered the shift, the share price movement in recent months may be enough to spark questions about where this stock is headed next. For those watching utilities and considering where value might come from, understanding what is moving AWK now is worth a closer look, especially as larger shifts in the sector can sometimes take a while to show up in quarterly...
